tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE user_profiles (
    user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    first_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    last_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    email VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE,
    date_of_birth DATE
);

CREATE TABLE user_profiles (
    user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE,
    email VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE,
    full_name VARCHAR(100),
    birth_date DATE,
    bio TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE authentication_credentials (
    user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50),
    password_hash VARCHAR(255),
    salt VARCHAR(50),
    last_login TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE users (
 user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 username VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE,
 password_hash VARCHAR(100),
 email VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE,
 registration_date TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE user_profiles (
 user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 full_name VARCHAR(100),
 birthday DATE,
 address VARCHAR(150),
 bio TEXT,
 profile_pic_url VARCHAR(200)
)

CREATE TABLE user_settings (
 user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 theme VARCHAR(20),
 language VARCHAR(20),
 timezone VARCHAR(30)
)

CREATE TABLE login_attempts (
 attempt_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
 username VARCHAR(50),
 attempt_time TIMESTAMP,
 success BOOLEAN
)
CREATE TABLE users (user_id INT PRIMARY KEY, username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, password VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL, email VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL);
CREATE TABLE user_profiles (profile_id INT PRIMARY KEY, user_id INT NOT NULL, full_name VARCHAR(100), date_of_birth DATE, gender CHAR(1));
CREATE TABLE authentication_tokens (token_id INT PRIMARY KEY, user_id INT NOT NULL, token VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL, expiration_date TIMESTAMP);
CREATE TABLE user_roles (role_id INT PRIMARY KEY, user_id INT NOT NULL, role_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL);
CREATE TABLE password_resets (reset_id INT PRIMARY KEY, user_id INT NOT NULL, reset_code VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, request_date TIMESTAMP);
